title.description: Optional world title to display when the game starts.

start.description: The location ID of the location the player will start in.

initial_inventory.description: List of item IDs for the items in the player's starting inventory.

initial_companions.description: List of item IDs for companion NPCs.

intro_text.description: Text to display when the game starts.

text_generation.description: Additional text for text generation system prompts. E.g. 'The tone should be serious and somber', or 'Phrase responses as if reading a storybook to the player.'

image_generation.description: Additional text for image generation prompts. E.g. 'Warm tones, fantasy storybook style.'

flags.description: List of global flag IDs. Flags can be set by interactions and used to enable/disable exits or interactions.

items.description: List of interactive game items. Includes portable (can be picked up), non-portable (never leave their original location) and NPCs.

name.description: The main name of the item. Used when displaying messages about the item. Used by the player to refer to the item in commands (e.g. TAKE FLASHLIGHT).

location_description.description: How the item is described as part of the location description. (E.g. 'A rusty sword leans against the wall.')

description.description: Displayed when the player examines the item. (E.g. 'An old, but serviceable short-sword. Despite a little rust, it still appears to be sharp.')

portable.description: If true, the player can TAKE and DROP the item. If false, the item will remain in its initial location.

aliases.description: List of aliases the player can use instead of the 'name' in the commands. E.g. 'brass key', 'key'.

npcs.description: NPC characters found in the world. Each one must have a corresponding 'item' with the same ID'

oneOf.description: Dialog tree to invoke when the player TALKs to the NPC.
Dialog to display when the player TALKs to the NPC.

dialog.description: Dialog tree to invoke when the player TALKs to the NPC.

persona.description: Only used in AI mode. A basic description of the NPC's persona.

sample_lines.description: Only used in AI mode. Example dialog lines for few-shot dialog generation.

quest_hook.description: Only used in AI mode. Contains quest related information for AI to take into account when generating dialog etc.

locations.description: Locations that the player navigates between.

description.description: The location description is displayed when the player enters a new location or uses the LOOK command.

items.description: A list of item IDs for items in the location.

exits.description: A list of exits from the location (to another location). Exits should be named 'north', 'south', 'east', 'west', combinations like 'northwest', or 'up' or 'down'.

to.description: The ID of the location the exit leads to.

description.description: Describes the exit. 'A narrow path winds along the cliffs towards...'

criteria.description: Criteria that must be satisfied for the exit to be usable.

blocked_description.description: Displayed when the player attempts to use the exit but the criteria is not satisfied.

interactions.description: Map of interaction IDs to verb interactions, each defining criteria and effects.

verb.description: The verb used in the command. Must be one of the predefined engine verbs, e.g. USE, OPEN, GIVE.

item.description: The item ID of the item specified in the interaction. The item must be in the location, or in the player's inventory.

target.description: The item ID of the target item. Applies to USE and GIVE verbs only.

criteria.description: Criteria that must be satisfied to perform the interaction.

effect.description: Change(s) to make when the interaction is performed.

consumes.description: If true the item will be removed from the game (and the player's inventory if applicable) when the interaction is performed.

repeatable.description: Whether the interaction can be repeated. If false, it can only be performed once.

message.description: Displayed to the user when they successfully perform the action.

requires_flags.description: Flags that must all be set in order to satisfy the criteria.

blocking_flags.description: Flags that must all be UNSET in order to satisfy the criteria.

requires_inventory.description: Items that must be in the player's inventory in order to satisfy the criteria.

set_flags.description: A list of flag IDs to set.

clear_flags.description: A list of flag IDs to clear.

criteria.description: Criteria that must be satisfied for the text to be displayed.

aliases.description: Additional keyword aliases for invoking the dialog.

criteria.description: Criteria that must be satisfied to make the dialog option available.

player_narrative.description: Describes what the player says when the option is selected.

npc_narrative.description: Describes what the NPC says in response to the player.

responses.description: Dialog subtrees based on follow-up responses the player can select from.
